attributes.action: agree to change the title of his office to “First Minister of England” as following the 1990’s devolution legislation, the office of Prime Minister no longer has responsibility for the major policy areas of Health and Education in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, but only in England.  The “Prime Minister” is therefore in many respects the equivalent of the Scottish First Minister and is in all but name only the First Minister of England.  Hence the official title should reflect the reality of the much diminished responsibilities of the office.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
